chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander E. Burmeister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SENTENCING HEARING IN 15CF188:
15CF188:
Ct. 2 (Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home-PTAC-Repeater)>> 9 Years WSPS- 5 Years IC and 4 ES, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination to equal full time, Attend and complete any assessments required by the Department of Corrections, No Contact with K.K. and S.G., Follow agent's supervision plan, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Eligible for programming CIP and SAP. COURT finds 292 days credit.

Ct. 3 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force-PTAC-Repeater)>> 12 Years WSPS- 7 IC and 5 ES, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination to equal full time, Attend and complete any assessments required by the Department of Corrections, No Contact with K.K. and S.G., Follow agent's supervision plan, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge remitted on Ct. 2. Eligible for programming CIP and SAP. COURT finds 292 days credit.

SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION in 11CF464 and 11CF899:
11CF464:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC)>> 3 1/2 Years WSPS, 18 Months IC and 2 Years ES, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination to equal full time, Attend and complete any assessments required by the Department of Corrections, No Contact with K.K. and S.G., Follow agent's supervision plan, Outstanding costs to be converted into a civil judgment, Eligible for programming CIP and SAP. COURT finds 329 days credit.

11CF899:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> 6 Years WSPS- 3 Years IC and 3 Years ES, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination to equal full time, Attend and complete any assessments required by the Department of Corrections, Outstanding costs to be converted into a civil judgment, Follow agent's supervision plan, Eligible for programming CIP and SAP. COURT finds 329 days credit.

DATES: Restitution Hearing is to be set in this case.
